newsitem.title: FRANCE: French capital markets closing report.
newsitem.headline: French capital markets closing report.

text.p: French bond futures ended the MATIF session off the lows touched after German unemployment data and a weak-demand OAT auction, but the 10-year future could test its contract high if US non-farm payrolls are favourable on Friday.

"If they're good, the notionnel should get back to 131.16, and why not further," said one trader. The outlook was basically positive and the very high German unemployment number gave new life to hopes of further rate cuts, the trader added.
Analysts said it was hard to measure when the Bundesbank might make a further cut in interest rates but it now looked like it would at least be under more pressure to do so.
"I think the Bundesbank is more sensitive to unemployment than in the past, in the run up to monetary union," said an analyst at Credit Lyonnais. "It wants growth under good conditions."
Speaking of the possibility of a Bundesbank rate cut, the analyst said, "There could be a window in the next four to six weeks."

On the other hand, the Bundesbank might be tempted to wait until the export lift from a stronger dollar wore off before moving, but in any case the feeling was the market had not seen the end of the cutting, the analyst added.
U.S. non-farm payrolls are expected to fall to 237,000 for January from 262,000 previously, with the unemployment rate expected to come down to 5.2 percent from 5.3 previously.

The 10-year future settled at 130.90 but off a low of 130.66 hit earlier in the day after a high German unemployment figure foot-faulted a curve-steepening play that has dominated the French market for a couple of weeks.
The dip was accentuated after demand at Thursday's OAT auction came in far weaker than expectations, but buying back at lower levels lifted it back later in the day.
